body_html:
I don't think it explains it because this problem is fixed by killing Python processes and restarting them on same instances.

I'm explicitly specifying zone to use, launching all instances into a single placement group. To be safe, I additionally mark master port to be reachable from public internet
body_text:
I don't think it explains it because this problem is fixed by killing Python processes and restarting them on same instances.
I'm explicitly specifying zone to use, launching all instances into a single placement group. To be safe, I additionally mark master port to be reachable from public internet
body:
I don't think it explains it because this problem is fixed by killing Python processes and restarting them on same instances.

I'm explicitly specifying [zone](https://github.com/diux-dev/cluster/blob/master/pytorch/launch_nv.py#L57) to use, launching all instances into a single [placement group](https://github.com/diux-dev/cluster/blob/master/pytorch/launch_nv.py#L45). To be safe, I additionally mark master [port](https://github.com/diux-dev/cluster/blob/master/pytorch/launch_nv.py#L246) to be [reachable](https://github.com/diux-dev/cluster/blob/master/create_resources.py#L141) from public internet
